subject: Law
title: Plea Bargaining
description: A quick, practical guide to Plea Bargaining.

hook.text: Over 90% of criminal cases never go to trial. The defendant pleads guilty in exchange for a lighter sentence.

buildup.text: Plea bargaining is a negotiation where the defendant agrees to plead guilty, usually to a lesser charge.

discovery.text: It saves the court system from collapse. Without plea deals, courts would need ten times the resources.

twist.text: Critics say it pressures innocent people to plead guilty rather than risk a harsher sentence at trial.

climax.text: The judge must approve the deal and confirm the defendant understands the rights being waived.

punchline.text: Justice is negotiated far more often than it's tried.

quiz.question: What percentage of US criminal cases are resolved by plea bargain?
